result.execSummary:
The defendant Mesheka S Wolfe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obtain Controlled Substance by Fraud, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.43(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
Court grants 191 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court Costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
Obtain GED.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Mesheka S Wolfe in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew R Rider.   Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties proceed to sentencing on Ct 6. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 6:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years - 191 days credit, Extended Supervision: 3 years) 
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00  to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision 
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- Conditions of  Extended Supervision: Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..  AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. Obtain GED.  No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.  Defendant to perform 50 hours of community service. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided.

requesting that the due date for the presentence for the defendant be extended to 04/14/2015 instead of 04/10/2015
Request granted.
